  3. Beinn Fhada

Beinn Fhada

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Beinn Fhada has a sprawling summit plateau with steep, craggy sides and several grand corries. It is well seen in the view from Morvich near the head of Loch Duich.

 You have not climbed Beinn Fhada.

Region: Kintail

Altitude: 1032 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 3.98/5
Rating: 4.0/5 (44 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Beinn Fhada from Morvich

Other routes and challenges

The description above includes several optional variations, including a descent of the Hunter's Ridge - a scramble.

Beinn Fhada can also be climbed via its long east ridge, which starts in one of Scotland's remoter locations at the head of Glen Affric - but convenient for anyone staying at Camban bothy or Alltbeithe youth hostel.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Kintail Hotels

Kintail B&B

Kintail Cottages

Kintail Hostels

There are 2485 Walkhighlanders who have climbed Beinn Fhada. They have contributed 58 public walk reports including this summit. These are ordered below with the most popular ones first. The rightmost column shows how many summits were included in their report, which may help you to find the most relevant reports.
